55902.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6d6b4","text":"Take an aliquot of culture:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"21fg3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cv9dd","text":"Take daily aliquots of culture and take measurements immediately or fix using  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":78,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"duijb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6sfq2","text":"The size of the aliquot depends on a number of things:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4n1aj","text":"-Total volume of culture","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7cm8j","text":"-Approximate concentration","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ip4c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ua11","text":"As multiple aliquots will be taken, it is important to not remove too much volume or biomass during the experiment, so as to not alter the conditions of the experiment too much. It is recommended to not remove more than 50% of the volume throughout the experiment, however less is preferable. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"97bst","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fs086","text":"In order to accurately estimate concentration, a minimum of 200 cells should be counted. Therefore if a culture was initially inoculated at 2000 cells/mL, aliquots for growth estimation should be at least   . The more cells counted, the greater the accuracy of the estimate. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":205,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a9586","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c7sjg","text":"If cells are clumping in the culture, gently agitate before taking the aliquot, take the aliquot from the center of the culture (rather than surface or bottom). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"60aer","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1atai","text":"If the culture is slow growing, aliquots may be taken every second or third day, at the discretion of the researcher. However it is preferable  to capture multiple data points during the exponential growth phase.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2h88s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":true,"cas_number":"30525-89-4","guid":"D2DC07905C5A11ECBA344B6D269F38A3","id":952923,"linfor":"","mol_weight":0,"name":"Paraformaldehyde 8% EM Grade aqueous solutions","pubchem_id":"0","public":0,"rrid":"","sku":"157-8","stats":{"total_protocols":0},"url":"https://www.emgrid.com.au/","vendor":{"id":0,"image":{"placeholder":null,"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"},"link":"","name":"Emgrid"}}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"886A26005C5B11ECBA344B6D269F38A3","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1ro3m","text":"Calculate the concentration of cells in the aliquot (remembering to account for the volume of the fixative if using preserved cells) and thus the concentration of the initial culture in cells per mL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9sbq8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ucd2","text":"I.e. Cells counted per volume counted.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"47s4s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d7pc8","text":"The classic equation for calculating microalgae growth rates based on two points is:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6vhk6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6oduh","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d2icu","text":"where F2 is the fluorescence measurement at time 2 (t2) in days and F1 is the fluorescence at time 1 (t1) in days if using in vivo fluorescence measurements. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ebq03","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fbtql","text":"Where cell counts are used, F2 and F1 are replaced with cell concentration at both times (C2 and C1).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c0pmb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2aiq","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1iqhd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"el08i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"flgn9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8pfiu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"C9FC3B405D4511ECBA344B6D269F38A3","height":42,"id":344690,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ksvwba5if.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ksvuba5if.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ksvvba5if.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ksvtba5if.webp","width":104}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5084DB505D4A11ECBA344B6D269F38A3","height":41,"id":344694,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ksv2ba5if.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ksvyba5if.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ksvzba5if.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ksvxba5if.webp","width":105}}}}

55902.section: Calculate growth rates for multiple time points
55902.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"43hc7","text":"Calculating growth rates for multiple time points, a linear regression is used of the ln(Fluorescence) or ln(cell concentration) plotted against time. A linear regression fitted during the exponential growth phase gives the growth rate (the slope).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8caip","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dck69","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"273ok","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5EF1BF605D4911ECBA344B6D269F38A3","height":390,"id":344698,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":24,"offset":52,"style":"italic"}],"key":"860gn","text":"Natural log of in vivo fluorescence over time for a Thalassiosira pseudonana culture. A linear regression is fitted across the exponential phase, with the slope giving the growth rate of the culture.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ksv6ba5if.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ksv4ba5if.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ksv5ba5if.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ksv3ba5if.webp","width":550}}}}

steps.section: Sample culture and fix for cell counts
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7fnja","text":"Take a    aliquot of each experimental culture/well (if growing in well-plates) and transfer into a 96 well round-bottomed plate to count via flow cytometry (see step 6).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":7,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"emv5l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6hem9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"48hir","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6hnui","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"200","error":false,"guid":"DF3F90C05D4E11EC87601917A664C093","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"equipment","mutability":"","data":{"id":2713,"brand":"Corning®","can_edit":0,"guid":"F051FCE05D4E11EC87601917A664C093","link":"https://www.sigmaaldrich.com","name":"96 Well TC-Treated Microplates","sku":"CLS3799-1EA","specifications":null,"type":"Microplate","vendor":{"id":17,"name":"Merck MilliporeSigma (Sigma-Aldrich)","link":"http://sigmaaldrich.com","is_requested":false,"image":{"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"}},"file":null,"image":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3pcfp","text":"Using a flow cytometer, count the concentration of the culture at T0 from the fixed aliquot using the protocol outlined below.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"agahn","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"88esd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":55902,"title":"Measuring growth rates of diatom cells in culture","title_html":"Measuring growth rates of diatom cells in culture","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"measuring-growth-rates-of-diatom-cells-in-culture-b2t6qere","image":{"source":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Phoebe Argyle","affiliation":null,"affiliation_url":null,"username":"phoebe-argyle","link":null,"image":{"source":"/img/avatars/007.png","placeholder":"/img/avatars/007.png","webp_source":""}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":6},"type_id":1,"guid":"1FC86FB061E411ECBE76B74FB3AA73DD"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dd679","text":"24 hours after the intiation of the assay, remove plates from the incubator and aliquot   of each culture (stained and unstained) into a round-bottomed 96 well plate for flow cytometry. Use a scalpel blade to slit the plate seal over each well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":88,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bgikf","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7iqks","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cdnd2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"200","error":false,"guid":"7E5514605D4E11EC87601917A664C093","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"equipment","mutability":"","data":{"id":2713,"brand":"Corning®","can_edit":0,"guid":"8E0C36405D4E11EC87601917A664C093","link":"https://www.sigmaaldrich.com","name":"96 Well TC-Treated Microplates","sku":"CLS3799-1EA","specifications":null,"type":"Microplate","vendor":{"id":17,"name":"Merck MilliporeSigma (Sigma-Aldrich)","link":"http://sigmaaldrich.com","is_requested":false,"image":{"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"}},"file":null,"image":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8p82","text":"Measure the PDMPO fluorescence of the stained and unstained cells using the flow cytometer, measuring at least 200 cells. PDMPO fluorescence is quantified using the near UV channel (275 nm excitation/490-530 nm emission). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f8chi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1is9u","text":"Also record the cell concentration. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8p6qu","text":"For the control samples:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3piqj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9odm1","text":"Measure the median PDMPO fluorescence of at least 200 cells for each sample using the same method as in step 8.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bvsuk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"38l55","text":"Calculate the growth rate of the unstained cells over 24 hours using the equation:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"10dtk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eflej","text":"    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"baaci","text":"where N is the number of cells per mL at time 2 (24 hours) and time 1 (initiation) and t2 and t1 are 1 and 0 (time in days).
